pullRequest.body:
This adds the missing instance `NormedField` â†’ `CompletableTopField`. See [here](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/287929-mathlib4/topic/Gelfand-Mazur.20theorem/near/493170291) on Zulip.

This needs to import both `Mathlib.Topology.Algebra.UniformField` and `Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Field.Lemmas`, which so far no file does, so I've opted to create a new file `Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Field.Instances` to house it.

Following suggestions made while discussing this PR, it also adds some API lemmas for filters.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [1ad7cabf96](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20686/commits/1ad7cabf9675e43332015a8443fc87c217a3e661)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Field.Instances` (new file)|1340|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ NormedField.instCompletableTopField`
`+ SeminormedGroup.disjoint_nhds`
`+ SeminormedGroup.disjoint_nhds_one`
`+ Tendsto.isBoundedUnder_comp`
`+ cauchy_iff_tendsto`
`+ cauchy_iff_tendsto_swapped`
`+ cauchy_map_iff_tendsto`
`+ cauchy_map_iff_tendsto_swapped`
`+ isBoundedUnder_map_iff`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13356913348/job/37300942846)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13356913348/job/37300942988)

```suggestion
    Disjoint (ğ“ x) f â†” âˆƒ Î´ > 0, âˆ€á¶  y in f, Î´ â‰¤ â€–y / xâ€– := by
  simp [NormedCommGroup.nhds_basis_norm_lt x |>.disjoint_iff_left, compl_setOf, eventually_iff]
```

Could you also add the one/zero version? I think for all these normed lemmas there's usually enough need to justify specializing in the zero case.

This is maybe too much hate on the epsilons and the deltas, but all of their work can be hidden behind [Filter.Tendsto.zero_mul_isBoundedUnder_le](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Analysis/Normed/Field/Lemmas.html#Filter.Tendsto.zero_mul_isBoundedUnder_le) and [Filter.isBoundedUnder_le_mul_tendsto_zero](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Analysis/Normed/Field/Lemmas.html#Filter.isBoundedUnder_le_mul_tendsto_zero) (which should have more symmetric names).

With these few lemmas:
```lean
-- Mathlib.Order.LiminfLimsup
theorem Filter.isBoundedUnder_map_iff {Î¹ Îº X : Type*} {r : X â†’ X â†’ Prop}
    {f : Î¹ â†’ X} {Ï† : Îº â†’ Î¹} {ğ“• : Filter Îº} :
    (map Ï† ğ“•).IsBoundedUnder r f â†” ğ“•.IsBoundedUnder r (f âˆ˜ Ï†) :=
  Iff.rfl

theorem Filter.Tendsto.isBoundedUnder_comp {Î¹ Îº X : Type*} {r : X â†’ X â†’ Prop}
    {f : Î¹ â†’ X} {Ï† : Îº â†’ Î¹} {ğ“• : Filter Î¹} {ğ“– : Filter Îº} (Ï†_tendsto : Tendsto Ï† ğ“– ğ“•)
    (ğ“•_bounded : ğ“•.IsBoundedUnder r f) :
    ğ“–.IsBoundedUnder r (f âˆ˜ Ï†) :=
  isBoundedUnder_map_iff.mp (ğ“•_bounded.mono Ï†_tendsto)

-- Mathlib.Topology.Algebra.UniformGroup.Basic
@[to_additive]
theorem UniformGroup.cauchy_iff_tendsto {G : Type*}
    [Group G] [UniformSpace G] [UniformGroup G] (ğ“• : Filter G) :
    Cauchy ğ“• â†” NeBot ğ“• âˆ§ Tendsto (fun p â†¦ p.1 / p.2) (ğ“• Ã—Ë¢ ğ“•) (ğ“ 1) := by
  simp [Cauchy, uniformity_eq_comap_nhds_one_swapped, â† tendsto_iff_comap]

@[to_additive]
theorem UniformGroup.cauchy_iff_tendsto_swapped {G : Type*}
    [Group G] [UniformSpace G] [UniformGroup G] (ğ“• : Filter G) :
    Cauchy ğ“• â†” NeBot ğ“• âˆ§ Tendsto (fun p â†¦ p.2 / p.1) (ğ“• Ã—Ë¢ ğ“•) (ğ“ 1) := by
  simp [Cauchy, uniformity_eq_comap_nhds_one, â† tendsto_iff_comap]

@[to_additive]
theorem UniformGroup.cauchy_map_iff_tendsto {Î¹ G : Type*}
    [Group G] [UniformSpace G] [UniformGroup G] (ğ“• : Filter Î¹)
    (f : Î¹ â†’ G) :
    Cauchy (map f ğ“•) â†” NeBot ğ“• âˆ§ Tendsto (fun p â†¦ f p.1 / f p.2) (ğ“• Ã—Ë¢ ğ“•) (ğ“ 1) := by
  simp [cauchy_map_iff, uniformity_eq_comap_nhds_one_swapped, Function.comp_def]

@[to_additive]
theorem UniformGroup.cauchy_map_iff_tendsto_swapped {Î¹ G : Type*}
    [Group G] [UniformSpace G] [UniformGroup G] (ğ“• : Filter Î¹)
    (f : Î¹ â†’ G) :
    Cauchy (map f ğ“•) â†” NeBot ğ“• âˆ§ Tendsto (fun p â†¦ f p.2 / f p.1) (ğ“• Ã—Ë¢ ğ“•) (ğ“ 1) := by
  simp [cauchy_map_iff, uniformity_eq_comap_nhds_one, Function.comp_def]
```

You can do
```suggestion
    obtain âŸ¨Î´, Î´_pos, hÎ´âŸ© := (disjoint_nhds_zero ..).mp <| disjoint_iff.mpr hn
    have f_bdd : f.IsBoundedUnder (Â· â‰¤ Â·) (â€–Â·â»Â¹â€–) :=
      âŸ¨Î´â»Â¹, hÎ´.mono fun y hy â†¦ le_inv_of_le_invâ‚€ Î´_pos (by simpa using hy)âŸ©
    have hâ‚€ : âˆ€á¶  y in f, y â‰  0 := hÎ´.mono fun y hy â†¦ by simpa using Î´_pos.trans_le hy
    have : âˆ€á¶  p in f Ã—Ë¢ f, p.1â»Â¹ - p.2â»Â¹ = p.1â»Â¹ * (p.2 - p.1) * p.2â»Â¹ :=
      hâ‚€.prod_mk hâ‚€ |>.mono fun âŸ¨x, yâŸ© âŸ¨hx, hyâŸ© â†¦ by simp [mul_sub, sub_mul, hx, hy]
    rw [UniformAddGroup.cauchy_iff_tendsto_swapped] at hc
    rw [UniformAddGroup.cauchy_map_iff_tendsto, tendsto_congr' this]
    refine âŸ¨hc.1, .zero_mul_isBoundedUnder_le ?_ <| tendsto_snd.isBoundedUnder_comp f_bddâŸ©
    exact isBoundedUnder_le_mul_tendsto_zero (tendsto_fst.isBoundedUnder_comp f_bdd) hc.2
```

This is not really shorter, but there is also way less happening. What do you think?
Note that even if you think this is too much, you can avoid some work by using eventually instead of explicit sets.
OK; thanks. This looks like a more idiomatic way of doing it (even though I have to admit that I find the other proof easier to understand :smile:).

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: instance NormedField.instCompletableTopField
